articles.content: The U.S. has demanded that Iran end its support for terror proxies in Syria and stop its nuclear and ballistic missile development in order to see the sanctions lifted. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said the sanctions are aimed at fundamentally altering the … [+1049 chars]

articles.author: Deborah Danan
articles.title: Watch: NBC News Airs Jewish Mourner's Prayer to Memorialize Pittsburgh Victims
articles.description: TEL AVIV – In an unusual move, NBC ended its Nightly News on Friday with the Jewish mourner’s prayer recited by a cantor in honor of the 11 victims of the Pittsburgh synagogue massacre.
articles.content: The network displayed the names and photos of the victims along with scenes from this past week in Pittsburgh as Cantor Avi Schwartz of the Park Avenue Synagogue in New York said the Kaddish. The show’s host Lester Holt said the gesture was inspired by the po… [+972 chars]

articles.author: Merrill Hope
articles.title: Georgia Sec. of State: Democrats Tried to ‘Hack’ Voter Registration Site
articles.description: Political tensions ratcheted further Sunday when Secretary of State (SOS) and Republican gubernatorial hopeful Brian Kemp’s office accused the Georgia Democratic Party of attempting to “breach” the state’s online voter registration system on Saturday. The Dep…
articles.content: The two statements issued by the Georgia SOS on Sunday are limited on details, but point a finger at the state Democratic Party committee for an alleged failed hacking. The initial release claims the possible cyber crime occurred on Saturday evening. While we… [+1724 chars]

articles.title: Rihanna: My Music will Never Play Again at Trump’s 'Tragic Rallies'
articles.description: Pop star Rihanna said Sunday that she will move to prevent her songs from being played at future Trump rallies.

articles.author: Michelle Moons
articles.title: Rep. Dana Rohrabacher Leads 9% over Democrat Harley Rouda in Poll
articles.description: Republican Rep. Dana Rohrabacher held a nine-point advantage over Democrat challenger Harley Rouda in a new poll as Republicans fight to hold control of the House.
articles.content: Rohrabacher broke the 50 percent threshold in the new Thomas Partners Strategies poll conducted October 18-31. Rouda came in at 41.6 percent to Rohrabacher’s 50.7 percent among 440 likely voters surveyed. The results represent a less than one percent change f… [+1522 chars]

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Georgia Governor Poll: Republican Brian Kemp Leads Democrat Stacey Abrams by 12 Points
articles.description: Republican gubernatorial candidate Brian Kemp is leading Democrat Stacey Abrams in a new poll just days before the Georgia governor's election.
articles.content: Kemp has broken away with a 12-point lead against Abrams in a Trafalgar Group poll of about 2,200 likely voters in Georgia. The poll reveals that nearly 50 percent of voters are decided on Kemp while only 35.9 percent say they will vote for Abrams. Another ne… [+788 chars]

articles.title: 2020: Michael Bloomberg Launches Last Minute Ad Touting Himself, Dems Before Tuesday Vote
articles.description: Michael Bloomberg is dropping an additional $5 million to air a new ad touting Democrats and himself ahead of the midterm election.
articles.content: Scheduled to air during Sunday’s broadcast of CBSs 60 Minutes and on CNN and MSNBC this Monday, the two-minute ad prominently features Bloomberg, who begins by stating that while “has never been a particularly partisan person,” the time has come to vote out R… [+2575 chars]

articles.title: House Battle Tightens, 10% Independents Undecided in Diane Harkey-Mike Levin Race
articles.description: The pivotal battle for long-time California Republican Rep. Darrell Issa’s congressional seat tightened in a poll released Friday as Republicans remain at risk of losing House control.
articles.content: Republican Harkey garnered 44 percent support to Democrat Levins 51 percent with a margin of error of 5.4 percent among the 500 likely voters surveyed from October 29 to November 1. Among independents only in the KGTV-San Diego Union-Tribune/SurveyUSA poll, t… [+1779 chars]

articles.author: Warner Todd Huston
articles.title: Weak 9: Thousands of Empty Seats Remain As NFL Starts Second Half of the Season
articles.description: With the National Football League now entering the second half of the 2018 season, some teams are still not drawing fans to the stadium.
articles.content: As in weeks past, the Washington Redskins seems to be lagging in attendance. While the Skins were trounced 38-14 at home in FedEx Field by the Atlanta Falcons, fans in the D.C. area seemed to have other things to do. Its crazy because there are so many seats … [+3392 chars]

articles.title: Pop Star Rihanna Endorses Andrew Gillum in Florida Gubernatorial Race
articles.description: Pop star Rihanna on Sunday afternoon announced her support for Democratic Florida gubernatorial nominee Andrew Gillum.
articles.content: “FLORIDA: You have the opportunity to make history this election. The US has only had four black Governors in its entire history, and we can help make #AndrewGillum the next one and Floridas first!” Rihanna wrote in an Instagram posted on Sunday afternoon: If… [+2648 chars]

articles.author: John Nolte
articles.title: Nolte – Another DC Disaster Looms: ‘Aquaman’ Tracking to Open at Franchise Low
articles.description: Aquaman, the latest chapter in the DC movie universe, is expected to open on December 21 anywhere between $40 and $60 million.
articles.content: How awful of an opening would that be? Let’s start by being charitable: If Aquaman manages to open to $60 million, it will be the eighth worst opening in DC’s history. But If Aquaman opens to just $40 million, it will be the 17th worst opening in DC’s history… [+2929 chars]

articles.title: University Professor Threatened After Criticizing Leftist Bias
articles.description: Professor Samuel Abrams received intimidating messages and was accused by his college president of “attacking” members of the community after he denounced the ideological homogeneity of his campus administration in an op-ed for the New York Times last month.
articles.content: Professor Abrams, who teaches politics and social science at Sarah Lawrence College in Yonkers, found menacing messages demanding that he leave the school posted on the door of his office. Decorations on the door, including pictures of his family, had been to… [+3033 chars]

articles.title: Venezuelans in Colombia Use Bolivars to Make and Sell Art
articles.description: Venezuelan refugees who have fled to Colombia are using their old currency to make and sell art in the street, local outlet La Opinión reported this week.
articles.content: In the border town of Cúcuta, where thousands of Venezuelans have migrated to escape the economic and humanitarian catastrophe in their homeland, five young entrepreneurs have started selling 16 separate artistic creations using the bolívar currency which, du… [+2264 chars]

articles.title: Former Criminals Get Training and Jobs in Donald Trump’s Go-Go Economy
articles.description: Baltimore construction firms are training and hiring hundreds of ex-convicts because they cannot hire enough migrants in President Donald Trump's "Hire American" economy.

articles.title: Republican Diane Harkey Leads Rally for Proposition 6 Gas Tax Repeal
articles.description: Republican Diane Harkey led a rally outside her Carlsbad, California, campaign office on Sunday afternoon for Proposition 6, the ballot initiative to repeal last year's 12-cent-per-gallon gas tax increase and vehicle fee hike.

articles.title: Pope Francis Prays for Victims of Islamic State Massacre in Egypt
articles.description: Pope Francis offered prayers for the Christians who were massacred by militants of the Islamic State on Friday “just because they were Christians.”
